title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:42 <vmassol> has quit  
08:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <vmassol> good morning  
09:15 <vmassol> cjdelisle: wdyt about generalizing our gotoPage() strategy un ui-tests by using the LoadableComponent strategy: http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/LoadableComponent ?  
09:15 <vmassol> s/un/in/  
09:16 <vmassol> if you're curious: http://code.google.com/p/selenium/source/browse/trunk/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/support/ui/LoadableComponent.java?r=11677  
09:17 <vmassol> and even better: http://www.google.com/codesearch#2tHw6m3DZzo/trunk/support/src/java/org/openqa/selenium/support/ui/SlowLoadableComponent.java&q=SlowLoadableComponent%20package:http://selenium%5C.googlecode%5C.com  
09:21 <vmassol> one issue is how to handle our inheritance hierarchy  
09:21 <vmassol> (since it uses extends)  
09:24 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <vmassol> I think I've found a way to remove a lot of flickering tests :)  
09:42 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <vmassol> testing it  
09:42 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <jvdrean> has quit  
09:45 <vmassol> "See http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Watchlist+Application#HAutoWatch for more."  
09:45 <vmassol> not very nice  
09:45 <vmassol> fixing  
09:46 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes wrote it a bit too quickly when I saw that there was nothing with that in the release note  
09:48 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <vmassol> myxwiki.org is failing agian a lot  
09:49 <vmassol> 7-10 times per day  
09:49 <vmassol> we need someone to look into it  
09:55 <+tmortagne> there is something weird on node1.myxwiki.org  
09:56 <+tmortagne> we have  
09:56 <+tmortagne> \*/1 \* \* \* \* /etc/init.d/xwiki.sh check-proc &> /dev/null  
09:56 <+tmortagne> \*/10 \* \* \* \* /etc/init.d/xwiki.sh check-http &> /dev/null  
09:56 <+tmortagne> in cron  
09:56 <+tmortagne> but i can't find any /etc/init.d/xwiki.sh file or it's empty  
09:56 <+tmortagne> forget that  
09:56 <+tmortagne> need to be root to read it actually  
10:00 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <AnnatarVarg> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <+tmortagne> egit 1.0 is still not very good with $Id$  
10:18 <+tmortagne> vmassol: found something :)  
10:18 <+tmortagne> look at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-wiki/src/main/resources/Main/WebHome.xml  
10:18 <+tmortagne> hint it's about the bug where watchlist is trying to send mails to WebHome user ;)  
10:18 <vmassol> there's a watchlist object  
10:19 <+tmortagne> :)  
10:19 <vmassol> blame blame!  
10:19 <AnnatarVarg> hello, i'm having a little trouble with customizing the registration page on a XE 2.7.2  
10:19 <+tmortagne> some people are not looking well at what they commit  
10:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <vmassol> lucaa?  
10:19 <AnnatarVarg> who can help me?  
10:19 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/5588bddb845b06dbd2505ac6cd383130eaa7efa7  
10:21 <+tmortagne> yep commented  
10:22 <AnnatarVarg> is now known as <sorzu>  
10:22 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <vmassol> ahah lucaa is here  
10:23 <+lucaa> I have no history though  
10:24 <vmassol> tmortagne has found the bug that we've been hunting for the past few days  
10:24 <+lucaa> so anything you said you'll have to resume  
10:24 <+tmortagne> lucaa: created XE-965  
10:24 <+tmortagne> here is a resume  
10:24 <vmassol> and for which I almost accused jvelociter yesterday  
10:24 <+tmortagne> almost ? :)  
10:24 <vmassol> and threatened him to rewrite all our functional tests  
10:24 <+lucaa> I committed that?  
10:24 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:24 <+jvelociter> ah-a !  
10:24 <+lucaa> sorry  
10:24 <+jvelociter> I should have accepte  
10:24 <+jvelociter> d  
10:24 <+tmortagne> i'm taking care of it  
10:25 <vmassol> jvelociter: at least it wasn't me! pfew  
10:25 <+lucaa> do you know how I created that?  
10:25 <+lucaa> I mean I just committed the watchlist object?  
10:25 <+tmortagne> not sure that's what cause the nullpointer  
10:25 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/5588bddb845b06dbd2505ac6cd383130eaa7efa7  
10:25 <+tmortagne> but that's what cause the watchlist trying to send mail to webhome at least  
10:26 <+tmortagne> lucaa: there is to be a bug that made wathclist create object for non existing user  
10:26 <+tmortagne> including empty user wich is resolverd in Main.WebHome  
10:26 <+tmortagne> but you should have checked the page before committing it  
10:27 <+lucaa> I did  
10:27 <+lucaa> some of it  
10:27 <+lucaa> it seems not all  
10:27 <+lucaa> but that makes it only partially my fault  
10:27 <+tmortagne> that's too easy :)  
10:28 <+lucaa> ok, it's my fault then  
10:28 <+lucaa> all my fault  
10:28 <+lucaa> sorry to have caused you all trouble  
10:28 <+lucaa> and get jvelociter almost killed  
10:32 <+tmortagne> vmassol, jvelociter: pushed, could you try to reproduce it to make sure it was what cause the nullpointer ? you can probably just remove the object from webhome and try to reproduce, no need to rebuild it all  
10:33 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: you did not created 3.1.1 version on jira for XE (at least)  
10:33 <+tmortagne> doing it for XE since I need it right now  
10:35 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you please update the release notes too?  
10:36 <+tmortagne> vmassol: to say what ? it's not really an issue, just pollute a bit the log  
10:36 <vmassol> (the known issue section, explaining what will happen if the user upgrades his home page)  
10:36 <vmassol> it's a known issue that is a regression  
10:36 <vmassol> all regressions deserves a mention  
10:36 <+tmortagne> I mean it does not break anything  
10:36 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <vmassol> it does  
10:36 <vmassol> all admins will look at the logs  
10:36 <vmassol> and think ther's a pb  
10:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: again as i told you i'm not sure that's the cause of the nullpointer  
10:37 <vmassol> ok I'll do it  
10:37 <vmassol> I don't have the time  
10:37 <+tmortagne> i could not reproduce  
10:37 <vmassol> but it'll faster than arguing  
10:38 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I'm not saying we should not say anything I'm talling you again that I'm not sure that's the real cause of the nullpointer no I cannot indicate anything in the release note  
10:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: is the watchlist in all translations?  
10:39 <vmassol> (for te home page)  
10:39 <+tmortagne> there is no translations anymore  
10:39 <vmassol> ah ok  
10:40 <+tmortagne> translation are on Welcome now  
10:50 <vmassol> jvelociter: you haven't found the issue and youre reverting right?  
10:50 <vmassol> will you have time to continue looking at it ?  
10:51 <+jvelociter> vmassol: I found the issue more or less. It's possibly a regression in restlet (or it's something that was working by accident)  
10:51 <+jvelociter> I'm writing to restlet guys now  
10:51 <vmassol> ok if you need help I can ping jerome louvel directly  
10:52 <+jvelociter> ok, cool  
10:52 <lucaa> has quit  
10:53 <vmassol> I'm so happy, I think I've fixed lots of flickering test issues all at once! :)  
10:54 <@sdumitriu> How?  
10:54 <@sdumitriu> BTW, I still don't see how http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/191/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/CreatePageTest/testCreatePageFromTemplate/ can be happening  
10:54 <+tmortagne> vmassol: would be nice  
10:55 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I've configured the driver to wait for its findElement operations  
10:56 <vmassol> (if the element isn't found immediatly)  
10:56 <vmassol> so no more need to add specific wait for  
10:56 <@sdumitriu> Hm, nice  
10:56 <vmassol> we'll actually be able to remove some we added in the past ;)  
10:57 <vmassol> I'm finishing testing before committing but it all seems nice  
10:57 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you mean things like the waitToLoad on https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/scheduler/elements/editor/SchedulerEditPage.java ?  
10:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: this case is different  
11:00 <sorzu> has quit  
11:39 <vmassol> fyi I'm finetuning my last change  
11:39 <vmassol> some of our code was waiting for elements to be not present  
11:40 <vmassol> fixing that  
11:42 <vmassol> hmm findElements code seem to wait too much  
11:42 <vmassol> debugging  
11:52 <+sburjan> vmassol: how did you configure the driver to wait for its fineElement operations ? I must know how to do that  
11:52 <+sburjan> it's too cool :)  
11:52 <vmassol> sburjan: it's done for all  
11:52 <vmassol> you don't need to set it  
11:53 <+sburjan> since the new version of Se ? Or you did some fintuning.. some driver settings ?  
11:53 <vmassol> check github  
11:53 <vmassol> you'll see exactly what I did  
11:56 <+sburjan>  // Temporarily remove the implicit wait on the driver since we're doing our own waits... <= by this you mean that we have wrapped wait from driver and created our custom waiter, right ?  
11:57 <vmassol> no  
11:57 <+sburjan> wait.. I will open Eclipse.. I don't know if getUtils() is written by us or not  
11:57 <vmassol> it's not so hard to rea  
11:57 <vmassol> read  
11:57 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/e24bfd5acc06c92d1b0cb6202c9659a5d4361eeb  
11:57 <vmassol> here: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/e24bfd5acc06c92d1b0cb6202c9659a5d4361eeb#diff-0  
11:58 <vmassol> this is the key:  driver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(getTimeout(), TimeUnit.SECONDS);  
11:59 <+sburjan> so I should conclude that their wait methods didn't work properly for us ?  
12:06 <vmassol> that's not a correct conclusion  
12:06 <vmassol> what wait?  
12:06 <vmassol> there's no wait on findElement by default  
12:06 <vmassol> (for a good reason)  
12:08 <+sburjan> but afaik there is a param to set a waiting time for finElement. nvm, I'll take a close look when I have time  
12:09 <vmassol> no there isn't  
12:11 <+sburjan> yes, you are right. I was confusing it with waitUntil.....  
12:21 <mflorea> has quit  
12:29 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <@sdumitriu> Good  
13:54 <vmassol> :)  
13:55 <@sdumitriu> Don't we have a message on the registration form that says that this is not a playground?  
13:56 <vmassol> it's not there anymore?  
13:57 <vmassol> it's there  
13:57 <vmassol> (just checked)  
13:57 <vmassol> You only need to join if you want to improve the documentation or provide comments. Please note that this is not a test wiki. We have setup a http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ for you to test drive XWiki (you'll need to register there and not on this wiki).  
13:57 <vmassol> Note that if you create spam on this wiki it'll be rolled-back and your user will be deleted without warning.  
13:57 <vmassol> If you're interested in contributing to XWiki please check the http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing.  
13:57 <vmassol> Thank you.  
13:57 <vmassol> pretty explicit IMO  
14:02 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
14:02 <@sdumitriu> Then why do people still come and sh|t over the wiki?  
14:04 <@sdumitriu> Another hanged build... http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/792/console  
14:06 <@sdumitriu> FYI on [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) I added aliases to go to the agents: a1 a2 a3  
14:09 <@sdumitriu> Whoa, "EvictionTimer-174" daemon  
14:09 <@sdumitriu> Why are the almost 200 eviction timers?  
14:09 <+tmortagne> because some loop keep creating caches probably  
14:10 <@sdumitriu> And lots of Lucene Index Updater threads as well  
14:10 <@sdumitriu> Looks like there are consecutive groups of 4 eviction + 1 lucene threads  
14:10 <@sdumitriu> All doing nothing at all, just sleeping  
14:11 <+tmortagne> maybe something is initializing plugins several times  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> Yes, probably  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> Since tests change XWikiPreferences a lot  
14:12 <+tmortagne> yep was thinking about this one  
14:12 <@sdumitriu> Someone recently touched the plugin initialization code  
14:12 <@sdumitriu> Who was it?  
14:13 <+tmortagne> I changed the way to receive the event about plugin field modification but not what we do when it happen  
14:13 <@sdumitriu> Looks like some plugins behave correctly  
14:13 <@sdumitriu> For example the scheduler  
14:13 <@sdumitriu> So it could be a bug in the plugins themselves  
14:14 <@sdumitriu> Since I'm working on Lucene anyway, I'll check what happens when the plugins are reinitialized  
14:14 <+tmortagne> hmm but lucene init did not changed recently AFAIK, I only worked on reindex method  
14:14 <+tmortagne> ok  
14:16 <+tmortagne> will check if it is really called only when the field is changed  
14:16 <+tmortagne> since it not supposed to be called for any xwikipreference modification  
14:17 <@sdumitriu> Could be an old bug  
14:17 <@sdumitriu> In the thread dump I don't see any processing threads  
14:18 <@sdumitriu> So the build could hang because the java process runs out of threads and it can't create new normal http processing threads  
14:19 <+tmortagne> I think I remember something about the number 200 as being the default maximum threads in Tomcat by default  
14:19 <+tmortagne> at least that was the maximum default or not in some other installation I looked at  
14:21 <@sdumitriu> Or are the @qtp threads the ones?  
14:22 <+tmortagne> looks like there is an issue with the ObjectProperty matching since the code is called for a modification of a field which have nothing to do with "plugin", fixing that  
14:27 <+tmortagne> actually BaseProperty is not generating the right reference  
14:31 <abusenius> has quit  
14:52 <asyd> has quit  
14:53 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: Any progress on the watchlist NPE?  
15:31 <vmassol> sdumitriu: we found the reason  
15:31 <vmassol> was a bug inroduced by anca  
15:31 <+tmortagne> vmassol: no we did not for sure  
15:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdym?  
15:31 <@sdumitriu> That doesn't make sense  
15:31 <+tmortagne> I told you several time: I fond why wtahclist was trying to send mail to webHome not why there was nullpointer  
15:31 <vmassol> it's 100% reproducible  
15:31 <vmassol> so it's easy to check  
15:31 <@sdumitriu> An extra object should not throw a NPE at \*that\* line  
15:32 <+tmortagne> and I asked you and jvelociter to check since I could not reproduce  
15:32 <+tmortagne> even with the object  
15:32 <vmassol> that doesn't make sense tmortagne  
15:32 <vmassol> I downloaded frmo maven.xwiki.org  
15:32 <vmassol> and it works all the time  
15:32 <vmassol> same for jenkins  
15:33 <vmassol> I'm pretty sure it's 100% reproducible  
15:33 <vmassol> any I don't have time now  
15:33 <vmassol> again  
15:33 <@sdumitriu> Well, the last build that I stopped a few minutes ago still had the NPE  
15:33 <vmassol> nor did I have this monring  
15:33 <@sdumitriu> Maybe it wasn't the most recent code on Jenkins, but before the fix  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> We'll see in the next build  
15:34 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I don't think nullpointer is fixed  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> Me neither  
15:34 <+tmortagne> what I fixed should never have produced this  
15:56 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:42 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
16:43 <evalica> has quit  
16:45 <jvelociter> has quit  
16:46 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
16:46 <sburjan> has quit  
16:51 <jamesxu> has quit  
17:15 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:31 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
17:31 <vmassol> cjdelisle: is that you who wrote testRedirectBackAfterLogin ?  
17:31 <vmassol> I'm trying to understand it  
17:32 <+abusenius> Q: does Main.Activity need PR?  
17:32 <+tmortagne> abusenius: I think I remember something like that yes  
17:32 <+abusenius> thats pretty bad  
17:33 <+tmortagne> yes  
17:33 <+abusenius> you can inject include macro there  
17:33 <+abusenius> and get pr pretty easily  
17:34 <+tmortagne> even without speaking about security there is no reason for somethis like that to  require programming right  
17:34 <+tmortagne> which makes it impossible to import for a subwiki admin  
17:35 <+tmortagne> (he can import but then it does not work)  
17:35 <+tmortagne> which makes it pretty bad since it's used on main page...  
17:35 <+abusenius> yea, definitely  
17:37 <+tmortagne> same thing for any other page of the standard xar which does not have any security reason to require PR (deleted attachments and document list for example)  
17:37 <+tmortagne> it's supposed to be a bug since a long time but looks like it's never fixed...  
17:45 <+abusenius> tmortagne: is there a specific bug for that? or just general one about not having pages with pr in default xar?  
17:45 <+tmortagne> vmassol, sdumitriu: do we still need overwrite xercesImpl now that we are using java 1.6 ? wasn't the issue related to the version in java 5 ?  
17:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: it would need to be checked carefully  
17:45 <vmassol> very carefully  
17:45 <+tmortagne> abusenius: we usually create a jira issue for each page  
17:46 <vmassol> it has important performance consequences  
17:46 <+tmortagne> otherwise it's impossible to close it  
17:46 <+abusenius> I'll report it then  
17:46 <+abusenius> can't find an existing report  
17:47 <+tmortagne> vmassol: will try to get the information, but wanted to check if it was the original reason  
17:47 <vmassol> it depends on the version of xecesimpl used  
17:49 <+tmortagne> it can also be an issue with a more recent version of xercesimpl you mean ? it's not just lets use the more recent one and it should be ok ?  
17:49 <@sdumitriu> I think the activity page requires PR just so that the macro is enabled  
17:49 <@sdumitriu> I'm not sure it uses protected APIs  
17:49 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: that's not required for macros  
17:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: if it's more recent than the one we use it should be ok but we need to check the performance. I must have put some comments in the pom I guess  
17:49 <+tmortagne> only to make macro available for the whole farm  
17:50 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok will check  
17:50 <+tmortagne> since xercesimpl is pretty big would be nice if we where able to get rid of it  
17:50 <+tmortagne> s/where/were/  
17:51 <vmassol> AFAIR the issue with the old version was a problem of caching of the XML DTDs/schemas  
17:51 <@sdumitriu> Depends on what version of xerces does the JRE bundle  
17:51 <+tmortagne> we are not using the last one btw it seems  
17:51 <+tmortagne> far from it actually  
17:56 <vmassol> note that if the ui tests are stuck, it's "normal" and is caused by my earlier changes  
17:56 <vmassol> (for some unknown reason to me findElements() is hanging with the implicit wait but findElement works fine)  
17:57 <vmassol> (I'm fixing tests one by one)  
17:58 <+tmortagne> vmassol: checked and java 6 is still using a very old version (2.6.2)  
17:59 <+tmortagne> so nothing to do here I guess  
18:06 <+abusenius> btw, how about sending out notifications about confidential jira issues to security mailing list?  
18:06 <@sdumitriu> I couldn't configure Jira to do that  
18:06 <vmassol> abusenius: good idea  
18:08 <+abusenius> sdumitriu: hm.. is there some other way to do that? maybe a plugin/extension or something?  
18:08 <vmassol> it's just a question of rights AFAIR  
18:08 <vmassol> however I dont have time to check right now  
18:09 <+abusenius> oh, and if not people on the security mailing list have access to confidential issues, then maybe just some notice that the issue bla was updated would already be nice  
18:09 <+abusenius> s/not/not all/  
18:09 <vmassol> that's harder to do  
18:10 <vmassol> the process is:  
18:10 <vmassol> create a user with correct rights  
18:10 <vmassol> create a personal filter  
18:10 <vmassol> ask to be sent that filter every week  
18:11 <vmassol> configure the user's mail to be the list  
18:11 <+abusenius> ok
